content: A message was moved here from #design > Follow Topics UI by Prakhar Pratyush.
I just add additional icon to them
As we add for resolved topics?
If yes, I think that will lead to the complexity of "changing topic names whenever we change the status to follow or remove follow."
I don't suggest to change names, icon isn't a name

Conceptually, I think decorating topics you're following in the left sidebar and "recent conversations" is probably a good idea. I guess we have that in "Recent conversations" already; but I'm not sure how to fit this into the left sidebar with it still looking good.
I already did it :smile:

https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/101-design/topic/UI.20redesign.3A.20left.20sidebar/near/1632175

image.png

While the resolved state is part of the topic name, it could of course be split out as Vlad indicates.

However, the resolved state is shared between everyone, while the following status is personal, so it would be clearer to group it near to the unread counts and @ indicators. I'm not sure if that was what Tim was alluding to, but it seems more challenging to include.
Yeah I don't think we can easily use the same spot for resolved and followed. Hmmm.
It could go on the spot where the @ appears for mentions, in that you probably don't care if you're following a topic if you've got unread mentions there.
Not sure what's good but generally I do like the idea of it being on the right side.

Like this ?
image.png
Do we plan to use an "eye" icon (which Vlad suggested above), or should we stick with the icon we have for "follow" (the bell icon)?

Prakhar Pratyush said:

Do we plan to use an "eye" icon (which Vlad suggested above), or should we stick with the icon we have for "follow" (the bell icon)?

Good catch. Those are two visual metaphors that shouldn't be mixed like that, I don't think.
They are not
Indicator on the topic got to be small. It uses an eye icon and in notification settings we have a bell with eye
We don’t show the bell in all the other streams and we shouldn’t show the bell here. Eye is enough

• we plan to show this "eye" icon for "Followed" topics in both the muted and not-muted streams?
  • We sort the unmuted topics up in muted streams; what should be our plan for "Followed Topics"?

Tim Abbott said:

we probably don't generally want to sort them to the top (as then it produces a weird UI if you've followed 20 topics in a stream, which is a very plausible state if you're automatically following any that you participate in),

I think the "Followed Topics" should not be less visible (if we don't sort them) in the left sidebar as compared to "Unmuted" topics in muted stream.

Sorting them will lead to the problem that Tim Abbott mentioned, but that problem is also associated with "automatically unmute topic policy".

For sorting, it seems reasonable to treat followed topics the same as unmuted topics. So we'd have followed/unmuted topics at the top in muted streams, and with normal recency sorting in unmuted streams. Does that sound right?

For the icon part, I'm a bit confused. In the version currently deployed here, it looks like we're using a ringing bell for followed topics (no eye):

Screen-Shot-2023-09-08-at-8.25.12-AM.png

The bell with an eye is being used for unmuted topics (in muted streams), not for followed topics:

Screen-Shot-2023-09-08-at-8.28.37-AM.png

For the icon part, I'm a bit confused. In the version currently deployed here, it looks like we're using a ringing bell for followed topics (no eye):

I had the same concern that I mentioned above

I'm still not clear about what Vlad Korobov said:

We don’t show the bell in all the other streams and we shouldn’t show the bell here. Eye is enough.
I was talking about the left side bar
Bell icon with eye on it would be too bulky
So just an eye is ok
Do we plan to show the icon for "Unmute" topics also ?
It is only for followed topics

Yes, the icon for "Follow" is "tilted bell".
follow

Bell icon with eye is for "unmute"

I'm suggesting to use the "tilted bell" icon (currently for follow); smaller in size.

If it seems bulky then I think we can move forward with only "eye".
Sorry but I think we misunderstood each other
I’ll try to come back with some better proposal

@Prakhar Pratyush I think it's probably reasonable to prototype with the ringing bell icon since that's already in the codebase -- that'll let us review and merge all the plumbing/logic for being able to include a followed topic indicator in the left sidebar, such that it'll be a CSS/HTML only change once we've finalized the design.
Sure, I'll do that.
Here's the PR: #26579
prototype

I think I did a mistake and would like to change icons between 2 items. Eye on a bell is telling "watch for all notifications", which means "follow". We are also following something with out eyes, not ears.
image.png

The last time we decided "Eye on a bell" for "Unmute" because:

When we unmute a topic in a muted stream; the fading goes away in the left sidebar (it is the first change which a user experiences); so for that reason "eye" with "bell".

Ringing bell signifies "aggressive notifications" i.e. Follow
ref: related thread

I'm willing to make ringing bell not that aggressive. I don't think Default and unmuted should be significantly different. The fact that Zulip logic is complicated doesn't mean that a person would understand the difference between unmuted and default. It feels like artificial complexity a user wouldn't care about
Hm, I dunno. The ringing bell make sense for "follow" to me -- you're asking to get extra notifications.

I don't think Default and unmuted should be significantly different. The fact that Zulip logic is complicated doesn't mean that a person would understand the difference between unmuted and default. It feels like artificial complexity a user wouldn't care about

That reasoning makes sense to me, but I don't think it follows that we want to use a ringing bell for "Unmuted". We can definitely brainstorm ideas other than the bell + eye concept...
Maybe the same bell as for Default but bold or filled in? I'm thinking about how to convey the intuition that it's a "normal" notification option, but one that's more "sticky" than "Default".
Filled icon os a great idea
I've merged #26579, will try to get it test-deployed today.

I'm seeing some "wiggle" on mouseover for the icons in the sidebar topic menu:
Screen-Recording-2023-09-11-at-10.06.40-PM.mov
Yes, this has been reported earlier. I'll work on this today. -- This is not related to the work we did in #26579 (merged today)
image.png

The outline bells form a kind of visual group for me…which makes me wonder if the solid bell works better as the default? And then you’d also have the Muted and Unmuted bells being distinguished from one another by just the slash?
Solid shouldn't be default - it is a stronger statement

Default and Unmuted is virtually identical. Only in a rare case when person unmute a topic in muted stream we for some reason think it is important to distinguish such state for a user... because what if they unmute the stream and now they would see that state of topic didn't change and it is unmuted...

Vlad Korobov said:

Solid shouldn't be default - it is a stronger statement

Hmmmmm. I could see that comparing it to just a single other icon, but in this group, the Gestalt effect kicks in and it reads more like an outlier rather than being particularly strong. But that could just be my own idiosyncratic brain-eyeball combination.

It is not about the menu itself but more about what will be hanging on the recipient bar. You see a menu with text labels for.. 5 seconds but after that you might see the bar with this icon in it for hours :smile:)
Ah, true :)

Prakhar Pratyush said:

  • We sort the unmuted topics up in muted streams; what should be our plan for "Followed Topics"?

Tim Abbott said:

we probably don't generally want to sort them to the top (as then it produces a weird UI if you've followed 20 topics in a stream, which is a very plausible state if you're automatically following any that you participate in),

Just noting here that there was feedback in #26632 from a user who has many unmuted topics in muted streams and does not find the sorting of those topics to the top of the list in the left sidebar to be useful.

Hmm, I'm not sure about the bell+eye icon, vs. using a ringing bell for followed topics. A ringing bell is much more of a standard icon (and corresponds to a real-world analogue), and seems appropriate to me for a "give me more notifications" configuration.
I guess here it is visual subjective perception. I don’t want topics that i follow show me big attention grabbing icon but some people do

Yeah it's a bit of a puzzle -- I think we do want it to be easy to see which topics in the sidebar are followed, but I would be pretty happy for the indicator of that fact to not draw amount of attention if you're not trying to look for the information.

Vlad Korobov said:

Like this ?
image.png

no .. it's not clear, it's better to put a small arrow like direct messages, which opens and closes the channel

Andrea Soc said:

Vlad Korobov said:

Like this ?
image.png

no .. it's not clear, it's better to put a small arrow like direct messages, which opens and closes the channel

We thought about the arrow and can add that but we would need to make other streams unfoldable

Vlad Korobov said:

image.png

@Vlad Korobov Could you provide the filled bell icon, unless you've done so elsewhere? I'd be excited to try it out for "Unmute".

Having mulled over it more, I'm still much happier with a ringing bell (as we have now) than with a bell+eye for followed topics. A bell+eye just feels like a really weird mixture of metaphors to me (combining seeing and hearing), whereas a ringing bell is intuitive for a setting that's more "alerty" than a stationary bell.
Ringing bell is not showing that I’m following something but that something is alerting me now
Watching for an alarm and alarming are a bit different states
Ringing bells attracts too much attention
I don’t have a better proposal for now
I guess following could be an exclamation point in a circle
I guess if you like what is now we can just use what we have
I guess bell + ear would be a version of bell + eye that doesn't mix metaphors. But it might look strange.
ear is pretty hard to recognize and it is noisy icon. Let me think about that for some time and something might come up
Yeah it's possible that mixing metaphors ends up being the best answer for icon reasons but probably deserves more thought.
I could even imagine rebranding the thing as "watch topic" if we really need to, but that's pretty high effort so would prefer not to do that unless we're really convinced it's the right plan.

So I have 2 proposals.

  1. Eye icon on a bell: image.png

  2. Louder sound/signal icon: image.png
The second proposal looks better to me.

I think the second icon would be comparatively better known as reddit uses such icon to label "live chat" in their feed (if I can recall correctly). So, it kind of "signals" something "urgent/important".
the first,the meaning is more intuitive

1. Additional option as a modifier of 2. Louder sound/signal but less like a radio or a Live icon:
    image.png
Mm, yeah, maybe (3) is the best option.

I think getting the icons finalized is the main blocker we have at this point for getting the feature deployed to Zulip Cloud. (It's OK if we eventually change our minds about the icons, but it would be nice not to do that a week after the feature launches. ;))
Svg icon following.svg
That last icon feels like the best of those options to me too. Would be great to get a few other thoughts/opinions.
